project_abstract.cdata: A loan of US$25.0 million is proposed to finance 50 percent of the costs of a population project over the next five years. The project is an integrated package designed to assist the broad program objectives of the population program and to strengthen the health and family planning delivery system of the department of health. It consists of two main components. The first supports a number of activities of the Population Commission (Information-Education-Communication, training and strengthening the regional offices of the POPCOM), while the second supports the department of health, mainly through the construction and equipping of 11 training centers and 205 rural health units through which health and family planning services would be delivered to the population.
